item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief

@MastrChief wrote:

Even better, upload everything to /smf or /forum or whatever you want to call the folder, upload index.php and settings.php to the main directory and edit settings.php to use the files from the forum folder.

item.title: How do i make a .org or .com web that leads strate to my forums?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“d_sign, post:10, topic:152772”]Create a new PHP page called ‘index.php’ after you buy your domain

Paste the following code into it:

<?php header( 'Location: http://YOUR.FORUM.LOCATION' ) ; ?>

Dont put any other code on the page. The reason that I didn’t say just use javascript is that not all browsers can, or will use that[/quote]

PHP headers like that are unnecessary.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make a .org or .com web that leads strate to my forums?

item.title: How do i make a .org or .com web that leads strate to my forums?
item.dc:creator: @d_sign d_sign
item.description:
@d_sign wrote:

Create a new PHP page called ‘index.php’ after you buy your domain

Paste the following code into it:

<?php header( 'Location: http://YOUR.FORUM.LOCATION' ) ; ?>

Dont put any other code on the page. The reason that I didn’t say just use javascript is that not all browsers can, or will use that

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make a .org or .com web that leads strate to my forums?

item.title: How do i make a .org or .com web that leads strate to my forums?

item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

yeah but if you do that your site will be messy why don’t you upload them into
www.forums.com/whatever/
and then make a index.php page in your main dir to redirect you soon as you go there you would hardly notice it and then you got a clean folder

item.title: How do i make a .org or .com web that leads strate to my forums?
item.dc:creator: @howlinghawk howlinghawk
item.description:
@howlinghawk wrote:

place the smf files in the main directory and not in a sub directory like /smf so you would have all the files on your main folder and not a sub dir

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make a .org or .com web that leads strate to my forums?

item.title: How do i make a .org or .com web that leads strate to my forums?
item.dc:creator: @VorargC VorargC
item.description:
@VorargC wrote:

Like, don’t make a new folder called SMF to put the files in, just put them on the main site, so when you go to the domain, it will go to forums.
So it will be like…
www.forums.com
instead of
www.forums.com/smf

Read full topic

item.title: How do i make a .org or .com web that leads strate to my forums?
item.dc:creator: @VorargC VorargC
item.description:
@VorargC wrote:

  1. Buy a domain.
  2. Forward the nameservers to your host.
  3. Add the site.
  4. Upload the smf files to the main directory of your website.
  5. Install it.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make a .org or .com web that leads strate to my forums?

item.title: How do i make a .org or .com web that leads strate to my forums?
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

2 ways, one of them I am not that sure about.
One (Easy way) - Create the index.html have the following:

<head>
<script>
location.replace('LINK HERE')
</script>
</head>

replace LINK HERE with the URL. That will replace the current index.html with the link, so you can’t press back.

2 (Not sure) - Make your server forward to the URL server host.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make a .org or .com web that leads strate to my forums?
